I have no persuasion, no urging. Let the Lord make the matter plain before your mind. You are in the service of God. Wherever you can serve Him best, I will be reconciled, but I set the matter before you and leave the decision to yourself. May the Lord abundantly bless you and commune with you and teach and guide you, is the prayer of your mother.--Letter 139, 1896. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Jan. 22, 1988. Entire Letter.
